<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Might it make more sense to define a more general `HasProd.norm` for arbitrary `NormedDivisionRing`s (which would work e.g. for the reals or p-adics too), and then derive the result for C from that via `Complex.norm_eq_abs`?

I have now done this. It requires `NormedField` rather than `NormedDivisionRing`, as that's the generality `norm_prod` is proved in. It also means we have quite a painful new import.
I also added a version for `abs`, also matching the generality `abs_prod` is proved in.

Ouch, yes, that's a really big import difference; probably too large to live with. Perhaps, rather than adding these lemmas there, it might be better to have a separate, new file just to hold these lemmas – maybe `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.InfiniteSum.NormedField` or something. 

I'm sorry to put you through so many iterations here.
GitHub doesn't support making suggestions on lines which aren't already part of the PR, so I made a tiny extra PR targetted against this one, #18792, with the fixes needed to get this to build.

I think this is looking good now

Might it make more sense to define a more general `HasProd.norm` for arbitrary `NormedDivisionRing`s (which would work e.g. for the reals or p-adics too), and then derive the result for C from that via `Complex.norm_eq_abs`?

I have now done this. It requires `NormedField` rather than `NormedDivisionRing`, as that's the generality `norm_prod` is proved in. It also means we have quite a painful new import.
I also added a version for `abs`, also matching the generality `abs_prod` is proved in.

Ouch, yes, that's a really big import difference; probably too large to live with. Perhaps, rather than adding these lemmas there, it might be better to have a separate, new file just to hold these lemmas – maybe `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.InfiniteSum.NormedField` or something. 

I'm sorry to put you through so many iterations here.
GitHub doesn't support making suggestions on lines which aren't already part of the PR, so I made a tiny extra PR targetted against this one, #18792, with the fixes needed to get this to build.

I think this is looking good now
